To Whom It May Concern:

On April 7, 2023, the Seattle Times reported "Port of Seattle nearly lost $570K to phishing emails, prompting audit" (https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/port-of-seattle-nearly-lost-570k-to-phishing-emails-prompting-audit/).

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request copies of the phishing emails, both as originally received and as forwarded to the Port's accounts payable department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Wallace

title: Elena Lozada (Maine Office of Chief Medical Examiner)

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Elena Lozada (Maine Office of Chief Medical Examiner)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, related in whole or in part, to the death and death investigation of Elena Jasmir Lozada, born 11/26/1985. 

Elena’s last communication with her family was on 7/5/2010 and was later  reported missing by her mother Carrie Cronkite to the Portland Police Department. In April of the following year (2011) her remains were discovered in Northport, ME. 

In addition I am requesting any pertinent information relating to any publicly named persons of interest, including but not limited to Nathan Mincher of Saco, ME. 

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am an individual seeking information for personal use and not for a commercial use. Elena was my best friend, and I am merely trying to gain a firm understanding of the truth.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically by e-mail attachment. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Amelia Houser

title: Gangstalking, Organized Stalking, or Group Stalking

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all information pertaining to, or including information about, the organized criminal phenomenon of Gangstalking, Organized Stalking, or Group Stalking.  This request includes any and all records about stalking committed by three or more people.

Requester also seeks all FOIA requests filed with this agency regarding any of the above-mentioned subjects, and all agency responses thereto.  Please include all agency responses in which an exemption from public disclosure is claimed or has been asserted.

Also, as stated in the last paragraph, “I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires”, the results I request have been replied with &/or attached to a prior request I mirrored while writing this one. title: Forms used to access Public Information under FOIA

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Forms used to access Public Information under FOIA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please be so kind to provide blank versions of any forms, paper or electronic, the City of Stamford  Police Department has employed from January 1, 2019 to July 15, 2023, which have been designed for and provided any citizens who make Freedom of Information requests from that agency.  One iteration of each version, if multiple versions exist,  of the request form(s) is sufficient to satisfy this request.  

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.
Police
Sincerely,

Robert Meehan

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Robert Cutler
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to, mentioning, or generated as a result of investigation of Robert Cutler (June 12, 1895 - May 8, 1974), who served as the first National Security Advisor. Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: James Kallstrom
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The personnel file of Assistant Director James Keith Kallstrom (May 6,  1943 - July 4, 2021), who served in the New York City field office from 1971 to his retirement in 1997. Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/08/us/james-kallstrom-dead.html.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of the February 2, 2021 shooting incident in Sunrise, Florida in which Special Agents Daniel Alfin and Laura Schwartzenberger were killed by David Lee Huber before taking his own life. Proof of death is not required as their deaths were widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/02/us/fbi-shooting-sunrise-florida.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: messages, board president
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

In a Twitter post, Board President Shi, head of the agency posted the following:

"While I am still figuring out what/when/how I am going to say things, to continue to practice transparency, I wanted to share a few things about where:
Email: Jshi5@cps.edu
Twitter: @JiananShi
Facebook: https://m.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100094730569723
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jiananshi_cpsboard/?igshid=OGQ5ZDc2ODk2ZA%3D%3D…"

Requesting all electronic messages on the above-referenced social media platforms excluding email (Twitter, Facebook and Instagram), including these profiles and any others that Board President Shi utilizes to conduct business between July 18, 2021 2023 through July 21, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

07/24/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR149738 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013964-072423 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Unprocessed Tamerlan Tsarnaev Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All previously unprocessed files on Tamerlan Tsarnaev, a well known public figure, whose death was widely reported in the media.

I am not interested in the files available on the Vault, 
https://vault.fbi.gov/tamerlan-tsarnaev/Tamerlan%20Tsarnaev%20Part%2001%20of%2002/view

Per my understanding of the FBI and their understanding of the FOIA process, I am also requesting that the search include "cross referenced" records, not just main file records.

I am making this request in my capacity as a journalist who has written extensively on government records, specifically on the FBI.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JPat Brown

communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am making this request in my capacity as a journalist who has written
    extensively on government records, specifically on the FBI.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Documentation Files

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    All previously unprocessed files on Tamerlan Tsarnaev, a well known public
    figure, whose death was widely reported in the media.
    
    I am not interested in the files available on the Vault,
    
    https://vault.fbi.gov/tamerlan-tsarnaev/Tamerlan%20Tsarnaev%20Part%2001%20of%2002/view
    
    Per my understanding of the FBI and their understanding of the FOIA process,
    I am also requesting that the search include "cross referenced" records, not
    just main file records.
    
    I am making this request in my capacity as a journalist who has written
    extensively on government records, specifically on the FBI.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    JPat Brown
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Funprocessed-tamerlan-tsarnaev-files-149728%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2Ib30IaPO2-FLw_1sYTM7eQ%3A1qNs7F%3A6Tv_gqlwX_cm_2sUmcZqSQhiMCwxEPQPGKIIR_ijIhc

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Electronic Signs on TV Monitors in RMV Service Center Waiting Areas (Registry of Motor Vehicles)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Electronic Signs on TV Monitors in RMV Service Center Waiting Areas (Registry of Motor Vehicles)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any and all advertising contracts, agreements, invitations for bid (IFB) and/or requests for responses (RFR) that were entered into and/or awarded by the Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles (RMV) and/or the Massachusetts Department of Transportation (DOT) concerning the vendor(s) chosen by the RMV and/or DOT between Jan. 1, 2009 and July 1, 2023 to place advertisements or other commercial materials on the electronic bulletin boards/electronic informational TV screens that are viewed by the general public when on the premises at various RMV locations, specifically the Boston (Haymarket) RMV Service Center and Revere RMV Service Center.  Please include any materials that indicate the costs of these agreements, contracts, IFBs and/or RFRs as well as any stipulations/requirements issued by the RMV and/or the DOT to potential vendors regarding what advertising and/or commercial material may and may not be included on the RMV’s electronic bulletin boards/electronic informational TV screens.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joan T Kennedy

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any police report (including any records referenced in the report, such as photographs, body camera recordings, or other records) concerning any alleged violation of Sec. 38-31 (Begging or soliciting alms). communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SSCT and Transportation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Official LAUSD documents which displayed the School Site Crisis Team and their protocols at Venice Senior High School for years 2006-2007 and 2014-2015. This should include the full group's names, titles, contact information. This should also include according to like documents days this team coordinated or met to train on School Site Crisis Team ("SSCT") protocols.

I also request the full official LAUSD contact directory for all Los Angeles School Police Department staff for school years 2006-2007 and 2014-2015.

I also request for all sports teams, classes, clubs at Venice Senior High School years 2006-2007 and 2014-2015 travel arrangement/planning as provided to parents and staff. This should include bus routing documents, transportation vendor plans, both nationally/internationally, prospective or actual.

In addition I request for years 2006-2007 and 2014-2015 all school bus routes with origins/ stops for transport of any individual being transported to or from Venice Senior High School or Venice Skills Center located nearby.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf

communications.subject: Auto Reply
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email is in response to your California Public Records Act (PRA) request.  Your request will be reviewed and the appropriate departments contacted to determine if disclosable records relevant to your request exist.

As required under California Code section 7922.535(a), the Los Angeles Unified School District (District) will make a determination within 10 days as to whether or not a request is seeking records that are publicly disclosable and, if so, to provide the estimated date that the records will be made available.  There is no requirement for a public agency to actually produce the records within 10 days of receiving a request, unless the requested records are readily available.  Still, the District prides itself on always providing all publicly disclosable records in as timely a manner as possible.

Should you have any questions, please contact the Office of the General Counsel at (213) 241-7600.

Thank you.

PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS EMAIL.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: On-call scheduling inquiry
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All letters, emails, and documents related to Attorney General Eric Schneiderman's 2014 request for information regarding "on call shifts" at retailers such as Abercrombie & Fitch, Gap, Target, and TJX Companies.

This request is being made for non-commercial research purposes and the requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer that the request be filled electronically by e-mail attachment if possible.

Thank you for your assistance with this request. I look forward to receiving your response within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management & Labor Relations

title: Rockledge, Florida: Language directed at police

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Rockledge, Florida: Language directed at police
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any police report (including any records referenced in the report, such as photographs, body camera recordings, or other records) concerning any alleged violation of Sec. 13-5(22) ("Any person who insults any police officer on the streets, public roads or other places while in the performance of his lawful duties or who makes derogatory or insulting remarks either to or about any police officer, or makes any sign, motion or gesture calculated to insult or humiliate such police officer or officers"). That ordinance may be located at https://library.municode.com/fl/rockledge/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=PTIICOOR_CH13OFMIPR_S13-5DICO.

This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2010.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
